episodeTitle: A Mystical City! The Grand Ruins of Shandora!
episodeTitleJapanese: 幻の都！雄大なるシャンドラの遺跡！！
episodeTitleRomanized: Maboroshi no miyako! Yūdai naru Shandora no iseki!!
description: Robin explores ancient ruins and encounters Yama, the Chief Enforcer, defeating him while protecting the historical monuments. She then discovers the legendary City of Gold, Shandora, and finds a Poneglyph hidden within. Meanwhile, Nami tests a refurbished Waver on the Going Merry with Conis, Pagaya, and Aisa, while Luffy remains trapped in a giant snake and Zoro befriends a South Bird.

events.title: Robin Encounters Yama, the Chief Enforcer
events.description: While exploring the ancient ruins on Upper Yard, Nico Robin encounters Yama, the massive Chief Enforcer of Enel's forces. Yama attacks Robin and begins destroying the historical monuments and ruins during their confrontation.
events.significance: This battle demonstrates Robin's combat abilities and her dedication to preserving historical artifacts. Yama represents Enel's destructive forces that have no regard for the ancient history of Shandora.

events.title: Robin Uses Veinte Fleur: Calendula
events.description: Robin deploys Veinte Fleur: Calendula (Twenty Flowers: Calendula) to create a defensive shield of twenty arms that protects the ancient monuments from Yama's destructive attacks. Despite taking damage herself, she prioritizes preserving the historical artifacts.
events.significance: First appearance of this defensive technique, showcasing Robin's versatility in using her Hana Hana no Mi powers. Demonstrates her commitment to protecting history even at personal risk.

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin creates a defensive barrier to protect the ruins from Yama's attack

events.title: Robin Decides to Lead Yama Away from the Ruins
events.description: After Yama continues to knowingly destroy the precious ruins, Robin chastises him and makes the strategic decision to lead him away from the monuments so she can fight freely without worrying about damaging the historical artifacts.
events.significance: Shows Robin's tactical thinking and her values - she's willing to fight at full strength only when the ruins are safe. This moment emphasizes the importance of preserving history in Robin's character arc.

events.title: Robin Uses Treinta Fleur: Hang
events.description: Once away from the ruins, Robin informs Yama she will now battle freely. She uses Treinta Fleur: Hang (Thirty Flowers: Hang), sprouting thirty arms from a high position to catch Yama mid-air when he attacks with Drop Mountain, then slams him against the ground.
events.significance: Debut of Treinta Fleur: Hang technique. Demonstrates Robin's increased offensive capability with her Devil Fruit powers during the Skypiea arc.

quotes.text: Now I can battle you freely, without any obstacles.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin prepares to fight Yama at full strength

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin catches Yama mid-air with thirty sprouted arms

events.title: Robin Uses Cien Fleur: Delphinium
events.description: When Yama attempts to attack with Axe Mountain, Robin turns his own dial weapon inward, trapping him with his own attack. She then finishes him with Cien Fleur: Delphinium (Hundred Flowers: Delphinium), sprouting one hundred arms that create a path to roll Yama off a cliff, followed by Clutch to completely defeat him.
events.significance: Debut of one of Robin's most powerful pre-timeskip techniques. This move demonstrates the full offensive potential of her Hana Hana no Mi abilities, using one hundred sprouted arms in coordinated attack.

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin uses one hundred arms to defeat Yama

events.title: Robin Defeats Yama, the Chief Enforcer
events.description: Robin successfully defeats Yama using Cien Fleur: Delphinium followed by Clutch. The massive Chief Enforcer falls from the cliff, completely beaten. This victory allows Robin to continue her exploration of the ruins unhindered.
events.significance: Major victory for Robin, defeating one of Enel's powerful enforcers solo. Establishes Robin as a capable combatant and clears the path for her to discover Shandora. Shows her growth since joining the Straw Hat crew.

events.title: Robin's Flashback to Alabasta
events.description: After defeating Yama, Robin has a brief flashback to her time in Alabasta, remembering events involving Nefertari Cobra and the Poneglyph she encountered there. This memory connects to her ongoing quest to uncover the True History.
events.significance: Connects the Skypiea arc back to the Alabasta arc, showing continuity in Robin's search for Poneglyphs and historical truth. Reminds viewers of Robin's ultimate goal beyond just adventure with the Straw Hats.

events.title: Robin Discovers the City of Gold, Shandora
events.description: Robin continues her exploration through the ruins and discovers a way to descend through the cloud layer. Cutting through the upper layer of clouds, she drops down to reveal the legendary lost city of Shandora - the City of Gold. The magnificent golden ruins spread out before her, confirming the legends were true.
events.significance: Major discovery - the legendary City of Gold that has been referenced throughout the Skypiea arc is finally revealed. This is the ancient Shandorian city that was blasted into the sky 400 years ago, containing crucial historical secrets and the Poneglyph Robin seeks.

events.title: Robin Finds the Shandorian Poneglyph
events.description: Deep within the ruins of Shandora, Robin discovers a Poneglyph - one of the ancient stone tablets inscribed with the lost language she can read. She realizes that the City of Gold, Shandora, was destroyed fighting to protect this Poneglyph, connecting it to the Void Century and the True History.
events.significance: Extremely significant discovery linking Shandora to the greater mystery of the Void Century and True History. The Poneglyph explains why Shandora was so important and why the Shandians have fought for 400 years. This discovery advances the overarching plot about the world's hidden history.

quotes.text: The City of Gold, Shandora... They fought to protect the Poneglyph.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin realizes the true significance of Shandora and why it was destroyed

events.title: Nami Tests the Refurbished Waver
events.description: On the Going Merry, Pagaya presents Nami with a newly refurbished and upgraded Waver - a dial-powered vehicle. Nami test drives it around the Going Merry and is impressed by its power. Pagaya explains that the Jet Dial propelling it has been thought extinct for centuries.
events.significance: Shows the bond between the Straw Hats and their Skypiean allies. The upgraded Waver becomes an important tool for Nami. Introduces the rare Jet Dial technology and Pagaya's engineering skills.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami comments on the upgraded Waver's performance

events.title: Conis, Pagaya, and Aisa Aboard the Going Merry
events.description: Conis, Pagaya, and Aisa are shown aboard the Going Merry helping Nami. Earlier they had saved Aisa from sky sharks after her Waver broke, and she directed them to the Straw Hats' ship. They are working together to help the crew escape.
events.significance: Demonstrates the alliance between the Straw Hats and the Skypieans. Shows how Pagaya and Conis are actively helping despite the danger from Enel. Aisa's Mantra (Observation Haki) makes her valuable for sensing danger.

events.title: Luffy Trapped Inside the Giant Snake
events.description: Luffy remains trapped inside Nola, the giant snake that swallowed him. He's trying desperately to find his way out of what he thinks is a cave, completely unaware he's inside a living creature. He's extremely hungry and wonders if the rest of his crew has found the City of Gold yet.
events.significance: Comedic subplot showing Luffy's obliviousness and single-minded focus on food and adventure. Sets up his eventual escape and reunion with the crew. Shows Luffy's durability and persistence.

events.title: Zoro Befriends a South Bird
events.description: Zoro decides to take a break from exploring to eat lunch when a Skypiean South Bird arrives. The bird shows interest in Zoro's meal, and although Zoro finishes without sharing, the bird decides to follow him anyway, beginning an unlikely friendship.
events.significance: Light-hearted character moment showing Zoro's ability to attract unusual companions. The South Bird becomes a recurring presence during this arc. Adds humor and shows Zoro's softer side despite his gruff exterior.

events.title: Enel's Survival Game Continues
events.description: Enel continues to monitor his twisted survival game, having determined that only five participants will be allowed to survive. He watches the various battles and movements across Upper Yard, confident in his plan to eliminate all threats to his rule.
events.significance: Maintains the tension and stakes of the Skypiea arc. Enel's god complex and ruthless nature are reinforced. Sets up the climactic confrontations to come as the survival game narrows down.

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Defending the ancient ruins from Yama's attack

quotes.text: Now I can battle you freely, without any obstacles.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin prepares to fight Yama at full strength

quotes.text: The City of Gold, Shandora... They fought to protect the Poneglyph.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin realizes the significance of Shandora

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the importance of protecting historical artifacts and knowledge. Robin risks her own safety to preserve the ancient ruins from destruction, showing her dedication to uncovering and protecting the True History.
themes.symbolism: The ruins of Shandora represent forgotten history that powerful forces want to keep buried. Robin's protection of the monuments symbolizes fighting against the erasure of truth.
culturalReferences: References to El Dorado legend and lost civilizations

themes.description: The episode reveals that Shandora was destroyed because its people fought to protect the Poneglyph. This parallels Robin's own fight to protect the ruins and her quest to preserve historical truth.
themes.symbolism: The Shandorians' 400-year war to reclaim their land represents fighting for heritage and identity. The Poneglyph symbolizes forbidden knowledge worth protecting at any cost.

themes.description: Robin's discovery of the legendary City of Gold represents the fulfillment of myths and legends. The episode captures the sense of wonder in uncovering lost civilizations and ancient mysteries.
themes.symbolism: The City of Gold hidden beneath clouds represents hidden truths waiting to be discovered. The descent through the clouds symbolizes breaking through barriers to reach deeper understanding.

characterSpotlights.development: This episode showcases Robin's combat abilities, her dedication to preserving history, and her ongoing quest to uncover the True History through Poneglyphs. We see her strategic thinking, powerful Devil Fruit techniques, and the emotional weight she carries in her search for answers about the Void Century.
keyActions: Encounters and battles Yama the Chief Enforcer
Uses Veinte Fleur: Calendula to protect the ruins
Strategically leads Yama away from monuments
Defeats Yama with Treinta Fleur: Hang and Cien Fleur: Delphinium
Discovers the legendary City of Gold, Shandora
Realizes Shandora fought to protect the Poneglyph
quotes: Now I can battle you freely, without any obstacles.
The City of Gold, Shandora... They fought to protect the Poneglyph.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her skills by expertly handling the upgraded Waver and coordinates with their Skypiean allies aboard the Going Merry. Shows her growth as navigator and tactician.
keyActions: Tests the refurbished Waver from Pagaya
Demonstrates excellent control of the dial-powered vehicle
Coordinates with Conis, Pagaya, and Aisa on the Going Merry

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands some of the battle sequences between Robin and Yama compared to the manga, adding more detail to her techniques and the destruction of the ruins.
In the manga, 'Thunder' is used while the anime adaptation uses 'Lightning' instead.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Shandora, the legendary City of Gold, which has been referenced since the beginning of the Skypiea arc as the ultimate treasure the various factions are seeking.

The episode covers content from multiple manga chapters (263-266, 268, 272), showing how the anime was adapting material in a non-linear fashion during the Skypiea arc to balance multiple concurrent storylines.
Cien Fleur: Delphinium, debuting in this episode, remains one of Robin's most powerful pre-timeskip techniques and is used against various opponents throughout the series.

sources.title: Hana Hana no Mi - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Shandorian Poneglyph discovered in this episode is later revealed to be one of the ancient stones that provides information about the Ancient Weapons, connecting to the larger mystery of the series.
The episode aired on November 16, 2003 in Japan, during the height of the Skypiea arc's popularity. The Funimation English dub didn't air until November 7, 2008, nearly five years later.
Pagaya mentions that the Jet Dial used in the upgraded Waver has been thought extinct for centuries, making it an extremely rare and valuable piece of technology.
